did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Audio Recordings,Correspondence, Research Materials, Newspapers, Printed Materials
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, articles, lectures, and subject files pertaining to Brumberg's career, her research on the history of home economics and her books: Mission for Life; Fasting Girls: the Emergence of Anorexia Nervosa as a Modern Disease; The Body Project: An Intimate History of American Girls; and Kansas Charley: the Story of a Nineteenth Century Boy Murderer.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor of Human Development, Cornell University.

Brumberg received her bachelor's degree in history from the University of Rochester in 1965, her master's degree in American studies from Boston College in 1971 and her doctoral degree in American history from the University of Virginia in 1978. She has served on the Cornell faculty since 1979 and was director of the Women's Studies Program from 1985 to 1988.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, articles, lectures, and subject files pertaining to Brumberg's career, her research on the history of home economics and her books: Mission for Life; Fasting Girls: the Emergence of Anorexia Nervosa as a Modern Disease; The Body Project: An Intimate History of American Girls; and Kansas Charley: the Story of a Nineteenth Century Boy Murderer.
Boxes 1-3 and 13-14 contain correspondence and subject files concerning the various books written by Joan.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State College of Human Ecology.Dept. of Human Development.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 1-3, 14-15 are closed until 2038 except by permission of the donor.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Joan Jacobs Brumberg papers, #23-3-3151. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
